conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As my goal is to sell the resource for ZUP, and it cost me 40 ZUP to produce, I'll start the bidding slightly higher to leave room for negotiation and to potentially cover my production costs and make a profit. </reason>

<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I am looking to sell my resource X. Considering the production costs and the value it offers, I believe 50 ZUP is a fair starting point for negotiation. Let's work together to find an acceptable trade. </message>

<other player message> I understand the value you've placed on your resource, and I am very interested in acquiring it. However, I would like to propose a slightly lower offer of 45 ZUP to leave room for both of us to find the best possible agreement. <my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>

<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your counter-offer and your interest in the resource. Meeting in the middle at 48 ZUP would be a fair deal for both of us, considering the costs and the value of the resource. I believe this is a fair compromise that reflects the quality of the resource while also respecting your position. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your willingness to negotiate. Meeting in the middle is a good strategy, and 48 ZUP is a fair suggestion. However, I would like to propose 46 ZUP as an attempt to reach a more favorable position for both of us. I believe this offer is in line with the value of the resource and shows my commitment to finalizing this trade. </other player message>

<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 46 </other player proposed trade>

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's proposal of 46 ZUP is higher than my production cost, ensuring I make a profit. Given that we need to reach an agreement and I want to ensure the sale, accepting this offer would be beneficial. This leaves room for just one more counter-proposal from my side if needed, but I'm inclined to accept this offer. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I accept your offer of 46 ZUP for my resource X. I believe this is a fair agreement for both parties, and I'm pleased we were able to come to a mutually beneficial conclusion. Thank you for your cooperation and fair negotiation. </message>
